about: Hi, I’m Somireddy Naveen Kumar Reddy — a Federated Learning researcher passionate about building AI systems that are not just smart, but also private, scalable, and adaptive. From computer vision to speech recognition, I’ve worked on solving real-world AI challenges like handling client dropout, tackling heterogeneous data, and making models efficient for edge devices. My mission is simple: push the boundaries of decentralized AI so it can empower industries and protect user privacy at the same time.

skills.specializations: Federated Learning, Continual Learning, Computer Vision, NLP

projects.description: A federated learning optimizer that handles client dropouts and slow learners using dynamic client substitution.
Generates dynamic scene graphs from images and videos for enhanced computer vision understanding.

experience.role: Research Intern – Continual Federated Learning & ASR
bullets: Developed C-FLAG integrating AGEM & memory-based gradients for low-forgetting continual learning.
Adapted Whisper-Tiny into a privacy-preserving multilingual ASR system for edge devices.
Improved model accuracy & retention across Split CIFAR-10/100 and TinyImageNet benchmarks.
Trained ResNet-18 on NIH Chest X-ray dataset using FL.
Proposed a client substitution strategy, boosting accuracy by 5–8% in dropout scenarios.
Designed dynamic client scheduling, improving convergence speed by optimizing resource allocation.

education.inst: Indian Institute of Engineering Science and Technology, Shibpur
